## Distinguishing Features



## Similar species

Lacking the bulbils of Phymatoceros bulbiculosus and possessing yellowed horns at maturity, P. oreganus could only be mistaken for Paraphymatoceros pearsonii. The distinction is microscopic and based on the colour and ornamentation of the spores.
